flawed_nl_solution:
Earl will have $90 - $28 = $<<90-28=62>>62 after paying off his debt to Fred.
Fred will have $48 + $28 = $<<48+28=76>>76 after being paid by Earl.
But then Fred will have $76 - $32 = $<<76-32=44>>44 after paying Greg.
Greg will have $36 + $32 = $<<36+32=64>>64 after Fred paid him.
Then, Greg will have $64 - $40 = $<<64-40=24>>24 after paying off his debt to Earl.
Then, Earl will then have $62 + $40 = $<<62+40=102>>102.
So together, Greg and Earl will have $24 + $102 = $<<24+102=126>>126.
#### 126

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 68, not 64. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
